summary: Stainless steel, an iron-chromium alloy, is known for its durability and resistance to rust. It's used in various industries due to its strength and easy-to-clean nature. This alloy is versatile; it can be shaped into sheets, bars, or tubing for different purposes. Common applications include kitchenware, medical tools, appliances, and industrial equipment. Its corrosion resistance makes it ideal for chemical and food storage. Stainless steel is identified by AISI numbers, and its compositions are standardized for global use.
title: Stainless steel
